MeasurementToolMetadata.Description: ADRC Uniform Data Set v3 - C2: Neuropsychological Battery Scores

age.Description: Age of the participant at visit

MOCACOMP.Description: Was any part of MoCA administered?

MOCAREAS.Description: Was any part of MoCA administered? If No, enter reason code, 95-98 (Blank if MOCACOMP = 1)

MOCALAN.Description: Language of MoCA administration (Blank if MOCACOMP = 0)

MOCALANX.Description: Language of MoCA administration - Other specify (Blank if MOCACOMP = 0 or MOCALAN ≠ 3)

MOCAVIS.Description: Subject was unable to complete one or more sections due to visual impairment (Blank if MOCACOMP = 0)

MOCAHEAR.Description: Subject was unable to complete one or more sections due to hearing impairment (Blank if MOCACOMP = 0)

MOCATOTS.Description: MoCA Total Raw Score - uncorrected (Blank if MOCACOMP = 0)

MOCACLOC.Description: MoCA: Visuospatial/executive - Clock contour (Blank if MOCACOMP = 0)

MOCACLON.Description: MoCA: Visuospatial/executive - Clock numbers (Blank if MOCACOMP = 0)

MOCACLOH.Description: MoCA: Visuospatial/executive - Clock hands (Blank if MOCACOMP = 0)

MOCAREGI.Description: MoCA: Memory - Registration (two trials) (Blank if MOCACOMP = 0)

MOCALETT.Description: MoCA: Attention - Letter A (Blank if MOCACOMP = 0)

MOCARECN.Description: MoCA: Delayed recall - No cue (Blank if MOCACOMP = 0)

MOCARECC.Description: MoCA: Delayed recall - Category cue (Blank if MOCACOMP = 0)

MOCARECR.Description: MoCA: Delayed recall - Recognition (Blank if MOCACOMP = 0)

NPSYCLOC.Description: The tests following the MoCA were administered?

NPSYLAN.Description: Tests following the MoCA: Language of test administration

NPSYLANX.Description: Tests following the MoCA: Language of test administration - Other specify (Blank if NPSYLAN ≠ 3)

CRAFTVRS.Description: Craft Story 21 Recall (Immediate): Total story units recalled, verbatim scoring {0..44}

CRAFTURS.Description: Craft Story 21 Recall (Immediate): Total story units recalled, paraphrase scoring {0..25} (Blank if CRAFTVRS in {95..98})

UDSBENTC.Description: Benson Complex Figure Copy: Total Score for copy of Benson figure {0..17}

DIGFORCT.Description: Number Span Test: Forward - Number of correct trials {0..14}

DIGFORSL.Description: Number Span Test: Forward - Longest span forward {0, 3..9} (Blank if DIGFORCT in {95..98})

DIGBACCT.Description: Number Span Test: Backward - Number of correct trials {0..14}

DIGBACLS.Description: Number Span Test: Backward - Longest span forward {0, 2..8} (Blank if DIGBACCT in {95..98})

ANIMALS.Description: Category Fluency - Animals: Total number of animals named in 60 seconds {0..77}

VEG.Description: Category Fluency - Vegetables: Total number of vegetables named in 60 seconds {0..77}

TRAILA.Description: Trail Making Test - Part A: Total number of seconds to complete {0..150}

TRAILARR.Description: Trail Making Test - Part A: Number of commission errors {0..40} (Blank if TRAILA in {995..998})

TRAILALI.Description: Trail Making Test - Part A: Number of correct lines {0..24} (Blank if TRAILA in {995..998})

TRAILB.Description: Trail Making Test - Part B: Total number of seconds to complete {0..300}

TRAILBRR.Description: Trail Making Test - Part B: Number of commission errors {0..40} (Blank if TRAILB in {995..998})

TRAILBLI.Description: Trail Making Test - Part B: Number of correct lines {0..24} (Blank if TRAILB in {995..998})

CRAFTDVR.Description: Craft Story 21 Recall (Delayed): Total story units recalled, verbatim scoring {0..44}

CRAFTDRE.Description: Craft Story 21 Recall (Delayed): Total story units recalled, paraphrase scoring {0..25} (Blank if CRAFTDVR in {95..98})

CRAFTDTI.Description: Craft Story 21 Recall (Delayed): Delay time {0..85} (Blank if CRAFTDVR in {95..98})

CRAFTCUE.Description: Craft Story 21 Recall (Delayed): Cue (boy) needed (Blank if CRAFTDVR in {95..98})

UDSBENTD.Description: Benson Complex Figure Recall: Total Score for drawing of Benson figure following 10- to 15-minuted delay {0..17}

UDSBENRS.Description: Benson Complex Figure Recall: Recognized original stimulus among four options (Blank if CRAFTDVR in {95..98})

MINTTOTW.Description: Multilingual Naming Test (MINT) - Total correct without semantic cue {0..32} (Blank if MINTTOTS in {95..98})

MINTSCNG.Description: Multilingual Naming Test (MINT) - Semantic cues: Number given {0..32} (Blank if MINTTOTS in {95..98})

MINTSCNC.Description: Multilingual Naming Test (MINT) - Semantic cues: Number correct with cue {0..32} (Blank if MINTTOTS in {95..98})

MINTPCNG.Description: Multilingual Naming Test (MINT) - Phonemic cues: Number given {0..32} (Blank if MINTTOTS in {95..98})

MINTPCNC.Description: Multilingual Naming Test (MINT) - Phonemic cues: Number correct with cue {0..32} (Blank if MINTTOTS in {95..98})

UDSVERFC.Description: Verbal Fluency: Phonemic Test - Number of correct F-words generated in 1 minute {0..40}

UDSVERFN.Description: Verbal Fluency: Phonemic Test - Number of correct F-words repeated in 1 minute {0..15} (Blank if UDSVERFC in {95..98})

UDSVERNF.Description: Verbal Fluency: Phonemic Test - Number of non-F-words and rule violation errors in 1 minute {0..15} (Blank if UDSVERFC in {95..98})

UDSVERLC.Description: Verbal Fluency: Phonemic Test - Number of correct L-words generated in 1 minute {0..40}

UDSVERLR.Description: Verbal Fluency: Phonemic Test - Number of correct L-words repeated in 1 minute {0..15} (Blank if UDSVERLC in {95..98})

UDSVERLN.Description: Verbal Fluency: Phonemic Test - Number of non-L-words and rule violation errors in 1 minute {0..15} (Blank if UDSVERLC in {95..98})

UDSVERTN.Description: Verbal Fluency: Phonemic Test - Total number of correct F-words and L-words {0..80} (Blank if UDSVERLC in {95..98})

UDSVERTE.Description: Verbal Fluency: Phonemic Test - Total number of F-words and L-words repetition errors {0..30} (Blank if UDSVERLC in {95..98})

UDSVERTI.Description: Verbal Fluency: Phonemic Test - Number of non-F/L-words and rule violation errors {0..30} (Blank if UDSVERLC in {95..98})

COGSTAT.Description: Overall appraisal: Per the clinician (e.g., neuropsychologist, behavioral neurologist, or other suitably qualified clinician), based on the UDS neuropsychological examination, the subjects cognitive status is deemed

Levels.3: One or two test scores abnormal
Levels.4: Three or more scores are abnormal or lower than expected
